Two found shot to death inside car in Chelsea

State and Chelsea police are investigating the death of a man and a woman who were found in a livery car that came to rest against a building in Chelsea. (8:35 a.m.)

Woman throws punch, mad about pickles

Police say a Quincy woman is facing charges for allegedly punching a restaurant worker who put ‘‘too many pickles’’ on her sandwich. (10:37 a.m.)

'Charity fatigue' felt after Marathon bombing

Nonprofit organizations are facing new fund-raising challenges from concerns over participating in large public events to fears of losing support amid the overwhelming charitable response to victims.

Boston PD to train police abroad

The Boston Police Department has signed on to a US State Department program that sends them to foreign nations to help train foreign police and form partnerships to fight international crime. (11:09 a.m.)

Business & Money

Mass. gas prices rise 6 cents a gallon

The average price for gas in Massachusetts was $3.48 a gallon in the latest weekly AAA survey, up 6 cents from the previous week’s average, AAA Southern New England said.
